check_box.label: Borderless Window Mode
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle between maximized borderless window mode and normal window mode.
check_box.name: FullscreenWindow

check_box.label: Enable VSync
check_box.tool_tip: Toggle whether the Viewer should use vertical synchronisation. This will lock the framerate to your screen refresh rate and prevent screen tearing. It is highly recommended not using this option as it slows down the Viewer internal processes greatly increasing rezzing times.
check_box.name: RenderVSyncEnable

icon.name: warning_ui_size2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using 'small' or 'big' interface size requires a restart. The UI is not designed for the 'small' or 'big' size, you will encounter problems.

combo_box.item.label: Tiny
combo_box.item.tool_tip: This option changes the UI size to tiny. ||UIScaleFactor: <blue>0.5</blue> ||<icon>Popup_Caution</icon> |Changing this option needs a restart otherwise all onscreen actions to inworld will have an offset. ||This option will break layouts, spacing, text labels and any sort of consistency in the UI. It is not recommended using this unless absolutely necessary.
combo_box.item.name: item0

icon.name: warning_font_dpi2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using a different DPI other than 96 will cause clipping text, broken labels, spacing issues and broken layouts, use with caution.

slider.label: Font DPI:
slider.tool_tip: Font DPI controls the size of all text in the Viewer. ||<icon>Popup_Caution</icon> |Changing this will break layouts, spacing and cause many parts of the UI to clip, overlap and sometimes be completely unreadable.
slider.name: DPI

icon.name: warning_texture_compression2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Using texture compression will save some texture memory but at a massive negative performance impact while loading textures and possible overarll as the Viewer spends most of its time processing textures.

check_box.label: Enable OpenGL 3.0 Texture Compression
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Medium ||Caution_Widget_Mini Caution Badge |This option enables texture compression, this will save some texture memory but will cause artifacts on textures and will impact the performance negatively.
check_box.name: CompressTextures

icon.name: warning_texture_memory2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: You might be allowing too much memory or even more than your GPU has available. Too high texture memory may cause drastic negative performance impact. Too low texture memory will cause faster texture trashing issues.

combo_box.item.label: 512 MB
combo_box.item.tool_tip: This This option sets the maximum amount of memory from your graphics card (VRAM) to be used for textures Too low values will cause texture thrashing. ||NOTE: |Keep in mind that all textures need to be saved in both your GPU's VRAM as well as your system's RAM. This also means it drastically increases the minimum RAM requirement. ||12GB RAM is recommended as minimum for this option. ||MaxTextureMemoryAllowed: 512

icon.name: warning_draw_distance2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Draw Distance has a high impact on performance for almost no visual gains in every day usage.

slider.label: Draw Distance:
slider.name: FarClip
slider.tool_tip: CPU: High |GPU: Low - Medium |Performance: Medium - Extreme |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls your view distance in meters, starting from your camera.

icon.name: warning_dynamic_lod2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Disabling Dynamic Level of Detail will make all object quality solely dependant on the 'Object Quality' setting, all objects will use the same level of detail no matter their distance to the camera.

check_box.label: Use Dynamic Level of Detail
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: None |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Low - Medium ||This option toggles dynamic Level-of-Detail which automatically adjusts the detail of meshes, prims and sculpts depending on distance.

icon.name: warning_object_occlusion2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Object-Object Occlusion may cause overall performance degradation, its usually worse in open but can be a lot better in enclosed areas.

check_box.label: Use Object-Object Occlusion
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: None |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: None ||This option toggles rendering of objects that are occluded by other objects. Can boost your performance depending on how much it is used. It will hurt your performance in open areas. ||Caution_Widget_Mini Caution Badge |Enabling this will cause water reflections to flicker at certain angles, it is highly recommend to leave it off.
check_box.name: UseOcclusion

check_box.label: Use Stream Draw
check_box.name: vbostream
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether the Viewer should draw updates per frame (Dynamic) or per render (Stream). Driver/GPU tweak may alter rendering bandwidth.

check_box.label: Use Plugin Read Thread
check_box.tool_tip: Use a seperate thread to read incoming messages from plugins like Webprims etc.
check_box.name: PluginUseReadThread

check_box.label: Use Far Clip
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the Viewer should render the fourth (last) segment of the camera view distance or not.
check_box.name: RenderUseFarClip

check_box.label: Render Unloaded Avatars
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the Viewer should render avatars that are not yet fully loaded (clouds) as clouds or their still-in-progress loading avatars.
check_box.name: UnloadedAvatars

check_box.label: Enable Fullbright
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether the Viewer should ignore the legacy fullbright flag on object surfaces. ||NOTE! |Does not work with prim param LIGHT script command and emmisive masks! ||<icon>Caution_Widget_Mini</icon> Caution Badge |Turning this option off will turn off the fullbright flag in objects to force the Viewer to treat objects as non-fullbright, due to how the Viewer works it will detect objects you select and look into as having fullbright turned off, editing your own objects will cause a parameter update to be sent, turning off fullbright permanently. DO NOT select objects you have edit permissions for after using this option.
check_box.name: EnableFullbright

check_box.label: Deferred Rendering
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Medium - High |Performance: Medium |Graphics: High ||This option toggles Deferred Rendering, improves and softens lighting, allows infinite light sources, directional projector lights, realtime shadows, Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) and more. This option is absolutely required for any of the advanced effects and tweaks to be visible.
check_box.name: Deferred

check_box.label: Render World Lights
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles unattached normal and projected lights in Deferred Rendering on or off.
check_box.name: RenderDeferredLights

check_box.label: Render Other Attached Lights
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles rendering attached lights on or off. Useful for annoying facelights.
check_box.name: RenderOtherAttachedLights

check_box.label: Render Own Attached Lights
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles rendering your own attached lights on or off.
check_box.name: RenderOwnAttachedLights

check_box.label: Render Environment Map
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles rendering the cheap and outdated environment map on shiny surfaces in Deferred Rendering on or off.
check_box.name: RenderDeferredEnvironmentMap

check_box.label: Render High Precision Normals
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles whether the Viewer should use high precision normal buffers or not. This directly affects the accuracy of light reflections on objects most noticably those of projector images. This increase memory usage by a varying amount depending on your screen resolution. To see the effects of this option you have to toggle Deferred Rendering off and on again.
check_box.name: RenderHighPrecisionNormals

check_box.label: Render Accurate Light Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low - Medium ||Caution_Widget_Mini Caution Badge |This option toggles whether the Viewer should use specularity on water for light reflections, allowing lights to reflect on water and shadows to occlude sunlight reflections. Note that this will however introduce an issue with water sunlight reflections glowing through fullbright objects similar to how the sunglare on shiny objects glow through fullbright objects.
check_box.name: RenderWaterLightReflections

check_box.label: Render Projector Image Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles rendering the projector image reflections on shiny surfaces with environment reflections enabled on or off.
check_box.name: RenderSpotLightReflections

check_box.label: Render Spotlight Light Refraction
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles rendering the light a projector projects into its set direction on or off.
check_box.name: RenderSpotLightImages

icon.name: warning_fxaa2

check_box.label: Automatic Shadow Distance
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: Low |Graphics: Low ||This option toggles whether the four shadow distance planes should be automatically calculated or set manually.
check_box.name: RenderShadowAutomaticDistance

slider.label: Closest Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Medium |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the space in meters the first and closest shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the first of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_X

slider.label: Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Medium |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option roughly controls the space in meters all shadowmaps cover. Affects precision of shadows in all four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowFarClip

slider.label: Close Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Medium |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the space in meters the second shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the second of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_Y

slider.label: Far Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Medium |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the space in meters the third shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the third of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_Z

slider.label: Distant Shadow Distance:
slider.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Medium |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the space in meters the fourth and last shadowmap covers. Affects precision of shadows in the last of four areas all shadows cover.
slider.name: RenderShadowDistance_W

check_box.label: Render Screen Space Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Medium - High |Performance: Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option toggles cheap looking but performance costly reflections based on a copy what you see on screen.
check_box.name: RenderScreenSpaceReflections

check_box.label: Include Roughness into Reflections
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Medium - High |Performance: Medium - High |Graphics: Low - Medium ||This option toggles whether Screen Space Reflections should scatter the reflection randomly based on the material roughness (glossiness) or not. This will drastically affect the performance of SSR even with lower SSR Resolution.
check_box.name: RenderSSRRoughness

icon.name: warning_ssr2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Screen Space Reflections may cause drastic performance degradation depending on the surface it is rendered on and the screen space resolution used.

slider.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Medium - High |Performance: Low - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the amount of iterations the screen space reflection shader should go through. More iterations mean finer grained reflections but also much higher performance impact.
slider.label: SSR Resolution:
slider.name: RenderSSRResolution

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the brightness of reflections on shiny surfaces from Screen Space Reflections.
slider.label: SSR Brightness:
slider.name: RenderSSRBrightness

check_box.label: Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO)
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Medium |Performance: Low |Graphics: Medium ||This option toggles Screen Space Ambient Occlusion (SSAO) emulating indirect lighting and the lack thereof giving objects a more realistic, less flat look.
check_box.name: UseSSAO

slider.label: SSAO Blur Size:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength of each blur pass of SSAO.
slider.name: RenderSSAOBlurSize

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength and thus darkness of each pixel of SSAO.
slider.label: SSAO Effect:
slider.name: SSAOEffect

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the size of the area SSAO is applied in, higher is a wider but weaker SSAO.
slider.label: SSAO Scale:
slider.name: SSAOScale

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the maximum size of the area SSAO is applied in, if max scale is smaller than scale it will be cut off creating a harsher SSAO outline.
slider.label: SSAO Max Scale:
slider.name: SSAOMaxScale

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the distance one object needs to be away from another to be eligible for SSAO, higher means more SSAO on objects further away from each other, possibly resulting in black ghost outlines around objects and avatars.
slider.label: SSAO Factor:
slider.name: SSAOFactor

check_box.label: Depth of Field
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: High |Performance: Low - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option toggles Depth of Field on or off, it is often used to blur out the background or unfocused parts of the scene.
check_box.name: UseDoF

check_box.label: Enable Alphas in Depth of Field calculations
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggle if the Viewer should include alphas and particles into the depth map. This will affect whether alpha transparent surfaces block godrays and if said surface is considered a solid surface when blurring.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldAlphas

check_box.label: Enable Foreground Blur in Depth of Field
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: Medium - High |Performance: Medium - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option toggles the foreground blur when using Depth of Field allowing you to blur only the background if desired.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldFront

check_box.label: Enable Depth of Field in Build mode
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether Depth of Field should be rendered while the Build window is open.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldInEditMode

check_box.label: Enable High Quality Depth of Field
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: High |Performance: High |Graphics: Medium ||This option toggles between the old, slow, high quality Depth of Field and the new, faster, lower quality Depth of Field.
check_box.name: RenderDepthOfFieldHighQuality

slider.label: Field of View(°):
slider.name: CameraFOV
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the vertical camera field of view in ° (Degrees) for Depth of Field.

slider.label: F-Number:
slider.name: CameraFNum
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the camera f-number value for Depth of Field.

slider.label: Focal Length(mm):
slider.name: CameraFocal
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the camera focal length in mm (Millimeters) for Depth of Field.

slider.label: Circle of Confusion:
slider.name: CameraCoF
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the camera circle of confusion for Depth of Field.

slider.label: Focus Transition Time(s):
slider.name: CameraFocusTrans
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the time in s (Seconds) it takes to switch focus from one point to another.

slider.label: Resolution Scale:
slider.name: CameraDoFRes
slider.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: High |Performance: Medium - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the sampling resolution for Depth of Field. It multiplies the current screen resolution with this number, lower means less accurate.

check_box.label: Motion Blur
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Low |Performance: Low - High |Graphics: Low - Medium ||This option toggles whether the Viewer should blur fast movement.
check_box.name: MotionBlur

combo_box.item.label: Objects Only
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low - Medium |Graphics: Low - Medium ||This option sets Motion Blur to include only objects and unrigged attachments.
combo_box.item.name: item0

combo_box.item.label: Self Only
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: Low - Medium |GPU: Low |Performance: Medium |Graphics: Medium ||This option sets Motion Blur to include all objects and your own rigged attachments.
combo_box.item.name: item1

combo_box.item.label: Objects and Others
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Low |Performance: Low - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option sets Motion Blur to include all objects and other people's rigged attachments but not your own.
combo_box.item.name: item2

combo_box.item.label: Everything
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: Medium |GPU: Low |Performance: Low - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option sets Motion Blur to include all objects, unrigged and rigged on everyone.
combo_box.item.name: item2

icon.name: warning_blur_quality2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: Motion Blur may look too strong and noticeable a low Motion Blur Quality setting.

combo_box.item.label: Low
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the quality and strength of Motion Blur. ||RenderMotionBlurStrength: 40
combo_box.item.name: item0

combo_box.item.label: Medium
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the quality and strength of Motion Blur. ||RenderMotionBlurStrength: 80
combo_box.item.name: item1

combo_box.item.label: High
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: Medium ||This option controls the quality and strength of Motion Blur. ||RenderMotionBlurStrength: 120
combo_box.item.name: item2

check_box.label: Volumetric Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Medium - High |Performance: Medium - High |Graphics: Medium ||This option toggles experimental volumetric lighting. This effect will create godrays if certain atmospheric criteria are met.
check_box.name: RenderGodrays

check_box.label: Directional Volumetric Lighting
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether Volumtric Lighting should fade out when looking away from the sun.
check_box.name: RenderGodraysDirectional

icon.name: warning_light_resolution2
icon.tool_tip: WARNING: A high volumetric light resolution may have medium performance impact depending on the scene and shadow resolution.

slider.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low - High |Performance: Low - High |Graphics: Low - Medium ||This option controls the amount of iterations Volumetric Lighting goes through, higher looks better but is slower. Performance impact also depends on shadow resolution.
slider.label: Light Resolution:
slider.name: GodraysResolution

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the brightness of each Volumetric Lighting iteration.
slider.label: Light Brightness:
slider.name: GodraysMultiplier

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength and distance at which Volumetric Lighting should be faded out around your camera.
slider.label: Light Brightness Falloff:
slider.name: GodraysFalloffMultiplier

check_box.label: Tone Mapping
check_box.tool_tip: CPU: Low |GPU: Low |Performance: Low |Graphics: Medium - High ||This option toggles Tone Mapping on or off. It is used to transform colors that are outside the visible range into a color range that most monitors can display while trying to keep the details of the scene such as the contrast intact, in short it compresses the whole color range which is partly not visible into one that can be displayed.
check_box.name: ToneMapping

combo_box.item.label: Filmic
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: None ||This option switches the Tone Mapping algorythm to 'Filmic'.
combo_box.item.name: item0

combo_box.item.label: Linear
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: None ||This option switches the Tone Mapping algorythm to 'Linear', similar to 'Custom' but without customizations.
combo_box.item.name: item1

combo_box.item.label: Rheinard
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: None ||This option switches the Tone Mapping algorythm to 'Rheinard'.
combo_box.item.name: item2

combo_box.item.label: Custom
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: None ||This option allows full control over the weights of the Tone Mapping algorythm.
combo_box.item.name: item3

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the exposure or overall brightness for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Tone Exposure:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneExposure

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the shoulder strength for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Shoulder Strength:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptA_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the linear strength for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Linear Strength:

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the linear angle for Tone Mapping.

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the toe strength for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Toe Strength:

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the the numerator for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Toe Numerator:

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the toe denominator for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Toe Denominator:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptB_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the linear white for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Linear White:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptC_X

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the exposure bias for Tone Mapping.
slider.label: Exposure Bias:
slider.name: ExodusRenderToneAdvOptC_Y

combo_box.item.label: None
combo_box.item.tool_tip: CPU: None |GPU: None |Performance: None |Graphics: None ||This option disables Color Correction.
